channel.title: Google adsense TOS
channel.description: I noticed mopar has ads on most pages even posting and the homepage. I read putting ads on these pages violates the adsense tos because they are autogenerated noncontent pages. Does Google allow this or do they just not really check?

item.title: Google adsense TOS
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

lordbost:

I removed the adds on my 404 and 403 page, at least till i have redesigned it.

I checked your 404 page, why have button links at the bottom that don’t do anything? I suggest removing the Facebook button and the other ones that aren’t anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Google adsense TOS
item.dc:creator: @lordbost lordbost
item.description:
@lordbost wrote:

O_o

EDIT: I got a new 404 page, do you think it have enough content?

http://lordbost.com/404

Read full topic

item.title: Google adsense TOS
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

dunno just thought there would be a maximum period of time they’d be able to keep data for, but i suppose if there is a good enough reason for it (which there is) they’re allowed.

Read full topic

item.title: Google adsense TOS
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:15, topic:341390”][quote author=jme link=topic=437787.msg3218145#msg3218145 date=1274903672]
I was banned from adsense forever, after asking people to click the ads on some site in my signature at kaitnieks forums. Like 5-6 years ago. They still won’t let me join :’(

They even sent me an email quoting my signature
[/quote]Similar thing here, and somehow google always know it’s you. I tried signing up with a different bank account and home address, but still didn’t work. Surely there’s something in the DPA about them having to delete data over x years old…[/quote]

Why would their be?

Read full topic

item.title: Google adsense TOS
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

nope, there isnt

Read full topic

They even sent me an email quoting my signature :P[/quote]Similar thing here, and somehow google always know it’s you. I tried signing up with a different bank account and home address, but still didn’t work. Surely there’s something in the DPA about them having to delete data over x years old…

Read full topic

item.title: Google adsense TOS
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“lordbost, post:5, topic:341390”]well, the 404 page only contains a link to http://lordbost.com.
and the 403 page have a list of countries that i have blocked from accessing my site.[/quote]

Why the hell would you be blocking entire countries from your website?

Read full topic

item.title: Google adsense TOS
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

and when it gets reported by someone you piss off, they ban you and you get no money at all

Read full topic

item.title: Google adsense TOS
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

random semi-related pro-tip: when placing adsense ads on places like error pages or something “seperate” from main site content, add them to a subchannel called ads or something. that way youll be able to seperate out the earnings for those ads and tell if its worth bothering with things like this thread discusses, or whether you can just ditch those ads.

Read full topic

item.title: Google adsense TOS
item.dc:creator: @lordbost lordbost
item.description:
@lordbost wrote:

I removed the adds on my 404 and 403 page, at least till i have redesigned it.

Read full topic

item.title: Google adsense TOS
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

It has to be text content that the context sensitive thing can match ads to

I’d probably do something like:

404 Not Found Blah Blah (Large enough to stand out)

… but here is a random forum post/page of content from the site instead, hope you enjoy it.

Or just not put ads on your 404, i doub they make much money anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Google adsense TOS
item.dc:creator: @lordbost lordbost
item.description:
@lordbost wrote:

what if i included a bit more information and maybe embed a random youtube video, do you think that will be enough content?

Read full topic

well, the 404 page only contains a link to http://lordbost.com.

item.title: Google adsense TOS
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

If the 404 and 403 contain content.

The problem is not whether login/error pages are login/error pages, but that adsense may not be placed on any page that doesn’t have text content.

Read full topic

item.title: Google adsense TOS
item.dc:creator: @lordbost lordbost
item.description:
@lordbost wrote:

Am i allowed to use ads on my 404 and 403 page?

Read full topic

item.description:
@Mopman wrote:
